back: The beginning, Creation of the world - Genesis 1
Creation of Adam and Even - Genesis 2
Satan and the fall of humanity into sin, Genesis 3-4
Atonement: the reconcilation between God and humankind accomplished through Jesus Christ
Babel, where God humbled humanity - Genesis 11
Abram and The Covenant: God called Abram to begin the redemptive process
God calls Abraham to create Israel to give birth to Jesus to save you
God changed Abram's name to Abraham and his grandson Jacob's name to Israel
12 sons / tribes of Israel (Jacob - Rachel - Leah:Joseph & Benjamin)
Joseph becomes a leader in Egypt under Pharaoh
Pharaoh fears growing power of Hebrews and enslaves them
Hebrew people are God's chosen people
God rescues his people from Egypt through Moses
Wandering in the wilderness for 40 years from Egypt to The Promised Land/Canaan - Book of Numbers
Israelites finally enter the Promised Land - Joshua
Period of Judges rule over 12 tribes of Israel
King David (shepard boy) unites Itribes into a single nation, Israel
David then son, Solomon, build the temple
Because of Solomon's sins, God allows the kingdom to split into Israel (north) and Judah (south)
Babylonians conquer Judah and took them into exile for 70 years
Persians let the Judahites return to Jerusalem and rebuild the temple
